intro: Echium brachystachyum, commonly known as the short-stalked fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, capsule-like fruits contain numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind. Echium brachystachyum is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand saline and arid conditions.
